meanings.definition: A type of cable used in the oil and gas industry for well logging and other downhole operations.
meanings.sent1: The wireline was carefully lowered into the well to gather data.
meanings.sent2: The wireline snapped under the pressure of the deep drilling.
meanings.sent3: The wireline decided to take a break and went fishing in the well.
meanings.sent4: The wireline connected the underground world to the surface like a secret messenger.
meanings.sent5: The wireline hummed with energy as it delved into the earth's depths.

meanings.definition: A method of communication using physical wires, as opposed to wireless technology.
meanings.sent1: The wireline connection was stable throughout the entire call.
meanings.sent2: The wireline system was upgraded to improve data transfer speeds.
meanings.sent3: The wireline and the wireless had a race to see who could transmit faster.
meanings.sent4: The wireline bridged the gap between two distant points effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The wireline buzzed with messages traveling back and forth.
